description: Certificate of Lawfulness (proposed) in connection with single storey part width extension at garden level, extending 3 metres beyond end of existing rear extension. Slight widening of upper level of rear extension. Formation of rear roof extension across full width of property. insertion of veluxes in front roof slope.
decision_conditions:
INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that the following conditions are imposed on the proposals under the terms of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008:
With respect to the rear extensions – 
(1) 'The materials used in any exterior work (other than materials used in the construction of a conservatory) shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse'
(2) 'Where the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse has more than one storey, the roof pitch of the enlarged part shall, so far as practicable, be the same as the roof pitch of the original dwellinghouse.'

 With respect to the roof extension – 
(3) 'The materials used in any exterior work shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse.'
(4) 'Other than in the case of a hip-to-gable enlargement, the edge of the enlargement closest to the eaves of the original roof shall, so far as practicable, be not less than 20 centimetres from the eaves of the original roof.'

With respect to the velux windows, the applicant is advised that under the terms of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, the veluxes are not permitted if they would protrude more than 150 millimetres beyond the plane of the slope of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof.
